synthlab.api
Class Port

java.lang.Object
  java.util.Observable
      synthlab.api.Port
Direct Known Subclasses:
BasicPort
public abstract class Port
extends java.util.Observable

This is one of the core classes of the synthesizer. A Port instance can represent either an input or an output port (depending how you add it to its module, using addInput() or addOutput()). A Port contains a buffer of samples that can be read or written by the module.

clone

public abstract Port clone()
                    throws java.lang.CloneNotSupportedException
Any port should be possible to clone

Overrides:
clone in class java.lang.Object

getDescription

public abstract java.lang.String getDescription()
This is a short description of this port. It could be queried if you wonder what is the use of this port, or in tooltips if you use a GUI.

getModule

public abstract Module getModule()
This will return the module that contains this port. If the port was not previously bound to an existing module, this will return null.

Returns:
the module that contains this port, null otherwise.

getName

public abstract java.lang.String getName()
This will return the name of the port. The convention is to prefix input port names with a "i" and output port names with an "o". e.g. iSignal, oFrequency...

getValueRange

public abstract Port.ValueRange getValueRange()
This will return the range of values (min/max) that this port handles.

Returns:

getValues

public abstract java.nio.ByteBuffer getValues()
This will return the current ByteBuffer representing the values that this port contains. Be sure not to modify it unless you specifically synchronize the port!.

Returns:
the ByteBuffer of this port.

getValueType

public abstract Port.ValueType getValueType()
This will return the type of value that is port is handling.

Returns:
the type of value that this port handles

getValueUnit

public abstract Port.ValueUnit getValueUnit()
This will return the unit in which the values of this port are stored.

Returns:
the unit in which the values of this port are stored.

isInput

public abstract boolean isInput()
This will return true if this port is an input port, false otherwise. If this port is not attached to any module, the result is undefined.

isLinked

public abstract boolean isLinked()
This will return true if this port is linked to an other one.

isOutput

public abstract boolean isOutput()
This will return true if this port is an output port, false otherwise. If this port is not attached to any module, the result is undefined.

resetValue

public abstract void resetValue()
This will overwrite this port's ByteBuffer with its original value defined when it was created. This is usefull for instance if you want to simulate that the port was unplugged.

setLinked

public abstract void setLinked(boolean linked)
This method is dangerous and should be called with care. This is used to set the status of the port to linked or unlinked. You can use it to force a port as unliked after you can deleted all its links. The only use of this method should be made through ModulePool instances, or if you are creating your custom port handling classes.

Parameters:
linked - true if this port is linked, false otherwise

setModule

public abstract void setModule(Module module)
This will assign a new module to this port. You generally should not use this method as it won't inform the module that is port is no longer owned! It is present for users willing to create their own module pool.

Parameters:
module -

setValues

public abstract void setValues(java.nio.ByteBuffer value)
This method will overwrite the value of this port's ByteBuffer with the one you provide. Be sure to provide a ByteBuffer which size is the same and the previous values (usually Scheduler.SamplingBufferSize) otherwise the results are undefined.

setValues

public abstract void setValues(double value)
This wil overwrite the values contained in this port's ByteBuffer with 'value'. This is usefull to set a whole sample set equal to a same value (for instance when reseting a port).

Parameters:
value - the value to be copied in this port's ByteBuffer
